text: there are no formal humanitarian
corridors no one could agree on them but
there's this thousands of people are now
fleeing everyday wherever they can
however they can these people came
through a hole that was smashed through
the wall near by that mosque and that
you can hear the fighting is still going
on they've all come from some South unit
where there's been intense fighting for
that area the Syrian army and its allies
have almost moved in but these people
have fled whenever they got a moment
they've lived with years of war but
everyone we speak to says they haven't
seen haven't lived through the fighting
that they have had of the last few days
children speak of being frightened
people living without enough food or
water and absolutely no safety even the
journey here was risky one woman told me
that they tried to escape a few days ago
they came under fire and her husband was
killed this year on her own with her
five children everyone here has a
terrible story to tell not knowing where
they'll go now not knowing when this war
will end they're dependent on handouts
dependent on a course of the war for
lives which bridge they have absolutely
no control
